summary: The Promoting Innovation in Pipeline Efficiency and Safety Act of 2025 (PIPES Act of 2025) amends Title 49, United States Code, to enhance pipeline safety. It addresses various aspects, including funding authorizations for pipeline safety programs, workforce development within the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration (PHMSA), updates to safety regulations, and the incorporation of industry standards. The bill also covers inspection activity reporting, technical safety standards, public engagement, class location changes, and the safety of carbon dioxide pipelines. It mandates studies on composite materials, geohazards, hydrogen, and emergency alert systems. It also includes provision for voluntary information-sharing and penalty for damaging pipeline infrastructure.
